verses.verse: {A Prayer for Deliverance} d In you, Lord , I take refuge; let me never be humiliated.
Rescue and deliver me, {So LXX DSS 4QPs a ; MT reads In your righteousness you are delivering me and rescuing me} because you are righteous. Turn your ear to me and save me.
Be my sheltering refuge where I may go continually; command my deliverance for you are my rock and fortress.
My God, deliver me from the power of the wicked and the grasp of ruthless practicers of evil.
For you are my hope, Lord God , my security since I was young.

I depended on you since birth, {Lit. you from the womb} when you brought me {So MT; LXX reads birth, it was you who sheltered me ; DSS 4QPs a reads birth, you are my protector} from my mother's womb; I praise you continually.
I have become an example to many that you are my strong refuge.
My mouth is filled with your praise and your splendor daily.
Don't throw me away when I am old; do not abandon me when my strength fails.
For my enemies talk against me; those who seek to kill me plot together
and say, "God has abandoned him. Run after him and seize him, because there's no deliverer."
God, do not be distant from me. My God, come quickly to help me.
Let my adversaries be ashamed and consumed; {So MT; LXX reads and let them expire ; DSS 4QPs a reads and let them be consumed} let those who seek my destruction be covered with scorn and disgrace.
As for me, I will hope continually and will praise you more and more.
I {Lit. My mouth} will declare your righteousness and your salvation every day, though I do not fully understand what the outcome will be. {Lit. understand the sum}
Lord God , I will come in the power of {The Heb. lacks the power of} your mighty acts, remembering your righteousness yours alone.
God, you taught me from my youth, so I am still declaring your awesome deeds.
Also, when I reach old age and have gray hair, God, do not forsake me, until I have declared your power to this generation and your might to the next one.
Your many righteous deeds, {Lit. righteous deeds as far as the height} God, are great,
God, who can compare to you, who caused me to experience {Lit. see} troubles that were numerous and disastrous? You will return to revive me and lift me up from the depths of the earth.
You will increase my honor and comfort me once again.
I also will praise you with the harp; because of your faithfulness, my God, I will praise you with the lyre Holy One of Israel.
My lips will shout for joy when I sing praise to you, whose life you have redeemed.
Moreover, my tongue will speak all day about your justice; for those who seek my destruction will be utterly humiliated.
